article:
The 'Terminologia Histologica' is a controlled vocabulary for use in cytology
and histology. In April 2011, Terminologia Histologica was
[http://www.unifr.ch/ifaa/ published online] by the Federative International
Programme on Anatomical Terminologies (FIPAT), the successor of FCAT.

It was intended to replace Nomina Histologica. The Nomina Histologica was
introduced in 1977, with the fourth edition of Nomina Anatomica.

It was developed by the Federative International Committee on Anatomical
Terminology.
